posts.message:
[align=center][IMG]http://i.minus.com/iFr3ysSi8zt0B.png[/IMG][/align]

The edition you are currently reading is the [color=#FFA52C][b]169th full edition[/b][/color]. To read any older editions of HF News, please go [url=http://goo.gl/pxojJ]here[/url]. 

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/ibbtDZ715LhhGY.png[/img][/align]
[color=white][b]Avatar Updates[/b][/color]
On Twitter, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b]Omniscient[/b][/url] announced that the size of avatars located in their posts has been increased in size from 70 by 70 to 100 by 100 pixels. In relation to this change, he also recommends that those who wish to do so should update their avatars to a better quality resolution or choose a new avatar all together. In combination with the news of custom avatars being allowed again without the use of Gravatar, this may be the moment some members have been waiting for for months. To visit the Twitter post, please read it [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet/statuses/402156679120171008]here[/url]. If you wish to read about the latest updates to the avatar upload system, you may do so [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3868144]here[/url].

[color=white][b]Introducing the Extra's Page[/b][/color]
Both on Twitter and on a forum thread, the advent of the Extra's page was announced this week by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b]Omniscient[/b][/url]. Located at the top of any forum page in between the "Members" and the "Help" button, members may now utilize the new "Extras" button to read the new page. As an effort to promote the additional and sometimes hard to find pages on Hack Forums such as the Deal Dispute Database, all of the pages that can be considered "extra", or not important enough to take a spot on the main navigation bar, can now be accessed through a single page. Also, it is noted on the Extra's page precisely which member groups may take advantage of what link. While some may be accessible to all members, such as the useful [url=http://hackforums.net/shell.php]Shell[/url], others are limited only to Ub3r or Staff members. Something that may catch member's eyes is the second to last column, having the name of the "Ep1c" usergroup. Whether this means that a new usergroup is close to being released has yet to be seen. The announcement can be viewed on either [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet/statuses/401267084648120321]Twitter[/url] or [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3866496]Hack Forums[/url].

[color=white][b]BitCoin Knowledge[/b][/color]
Not having heard of the currency known as BitCoins while spending time on Hack Forums is a rare occurrence. In relevance to the increasing trend of BitCoin usage around the forum, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b]Omniscient[/b][/url] has released a useful tool to the upgraded member groups to follow the latest trends of BitCoin prices, which can be seen [url=http://hackforums.net/btcv.php]here[/url]. The page includes information such as the last price, the latest bid and ask, along with the 24 hour low, high, and volume data doubles. The addition was announced both on [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet/statuses/401112128079147008]Twitter[/url] and a [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3865681]Hack Froums thread[/url].

[color=white][b]Minimum Posts to PM Increased & Israel Blocked Permanently[/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b]Omniscient[/b][/url] has announced on [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet/statuses/401430719513128960]Twitter[/url] that the minimum amount of posts in order to send PMs has been increased for new members as a result of excessive amounts of low quality posts and spam. 25 posts may take a while to amass, increasing the likelihood of unwanted members being caught and taken care of before they have an opportunity to privately contact members on-site. In addition, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b]Omniscient[/b][/url] has [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3863817&pid=36318731#pid36318731]stated[/url] that Israel will never be lifted from the block list again because of the amount of ban evaders and scammers evidently emanating from said country. While it may come to the dismay and inconvenience of some members from Israel, it will surely increase the security of the forum for the remaining users.

[b]We need [i]YOUR [/i]help![/b] See a thread you believe is notable (and was posted recently)? Report that thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3673692]here[/url]. Thanks!

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/iV2Z5H1KVQP4W.png[/img][/align]
[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Welcome the the 169th edition of the HF News! How are ya doing? Anyone you'd like to mention before we continue?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] Frankly, I don't know too much people so I would have to say, Freddy, Sejskaler, and Rebecca Black Tech.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] How'd you find your way to this site? Did you sign up for debates, or for hacking? I see that you're active in the SRPP.
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] I signed up because I wanted to learn about stressers and booters, happened when I was on Xbox Live and I got hit offline so I wanted vengeance. I lost the burning passion I needed to learn and the patience, so I made my way to the SRPP section because as a hobby I was always reading about religion and philosophy. Now I am no longer active because the topics are recycled and trolls are finding the section. 

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Ah, good ole' Xbox. What interests you now on here? Do you still
game?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] I am just posting around with no particular direction or purpose, however I am just focusing on being a leader in The Empire and passing the probation tests (hopefully). As for gaming, yeah I just got back to it recently. I was doing a lot of gaming on the PS3 but, got tired and started on Xbox once again, and the raging continues. #CoDGhostsproblems

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Glad you're on Xbox again (Finally!). Do you have any plans on upgrading to the latest and greatest consoles? Also, what do you think of Ghosts?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] I have already reserved and paid for both the Xbox One and the Play Station 4, my wife wanted the PS4 very badly so I had to buy it. Ghosts is a good game (surprisingly) I was expecting it to be absolutely terrible but it was enjoyable. I do dislike the overly huge maps, it doesn't feel like a Call of Duty sized maps. The maps that were perfect where the ones in Call of Duty 4. I guess that won't comeback.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] I think they're trying to tear away from it's predecessors and create something new. I'm also getting the Xbone. Can't wait for the new consoles. What do you do outside of HF?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] Outside of HF, I work in a paintshop, I don't paint yet, but, I am training for it, other than that I do a little skateboarding, I used to do some free running. I started doing some Kick-boxing but, I didn't go through it, being a father, and just generally gaming in my free time. Nothing much really.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Seems like you're always on the move. How long have you been skateboarding? Free running seems like it'd be hard to do. Any tips?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] I skateboarded for a few months, I was never a great skateboarder. For Free Running, I never attempted to jump down from tall buildings or jump from building to building. That is a little too much for me, all I did was backflips and jumping from obstacles. Just the normal, ground based stunts.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Oh, true! How's work doing for ya? Is it like a studio or something like that?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] I don't think where I work is a studio, but, the work is going great, it's something that even though it's hard it does not get boring. Like the other day, one of the guys missed a day so, I had to do his work. I sanded 3 cars in a day. I was dead after that.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Well, at least you're enjoyin' what you do. Are you working on any projects here? Or is it a secret?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] I was actually planning on making another big thread for the SRPP section, to bring more unique topics to the table but, I lost all my desire to do so. I can't stand to sit here and type long and detailed paragraphs only to have them ignored because in the SRPP section, barely anybody reads the whole threads before disagreeing. The is a major downer.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] That's a shame. I still think you should go ahead and post it up. Do you have any goals on the forum?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] Actually, I have none, I never aimed to do something on the forum other than just post and have a good time. I guess my goal would be to still have fun and post around for months to come, while meeting new and cool people.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Having a good time and making friends is what it's all about. You have anything you'd like to say before we're done?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1374951]Evangelist[/url]:[/b][/color] I am not a person of many words, but, thank you for the interview and have a great day and a long time with the Writers.[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1234186]#Chester[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Hello everyone! Welcome to the 169th edition of the HF News! Today we'll be interviewing the member #Chester! Hello #Chester, thanks for joining us today. Do you have any shoutouts you'd like to make before we proceed?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] Shoutout to Darkwin, TheHackerLove, and Vinnie.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] So how did you manage to find your way to Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] I found my way onto Hackforums from a site called TheTechGame I used to try and mod games and I forgot exactly how it went but in the Premium member lounge one of the members mentioned Hack Forums and I joined and I haven't looked back.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Ahh yes of course, TTG. We're all familiar with that site! So do you still visit TTG or are you strictly a Hack Forums kinda guy now?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] I go on from time to time I'll buy gold and see what is going on. So much has changed there that I really can't get back into it I'm a HF type of guy now.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] That's what we like to hear. So why don't you tell us about some of your hobbies? Do any of them relate to Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] Well I love going to the mall and hanging out with my friends! I also love coding sites which I got into when I joined HF and browsed the coding section after that I just started experimenting and really got into it.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] That's awesome! I happen to do a bit of that too. Are you looking to become a web dev/designer? If not, what do you see yourself doing in the future?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] I am thinking of maybe becoming a Web Dev on the side but as a full time job I see myself being a Prosecutor.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] So you registered on March 27th, 2012. Since then, what has been your proudest moment on Hack Forums? 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] Honestly I am not certain. Nothing is really popping up but all the moments I have on HF have taught me some sort of lesson.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] That's good. Are there any goals you'd like to see yourself achieve over the next year or so on Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] Not really. I like where I am at. Actually scratch that there is one I want to hit 500 Prestige for some reason the prestige system intrigues me. Other that that I think I am good.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Would you mind telling us a little bit more about yourself in general? Is there anything specifically you'd like the readers to know about you?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] Well here is a little info about me my Name is Chester Diante Turner I am 17 I was born July 4th,1996 and right now just trying to live my life to the fullest. If anyone has any specific questions I am willing to answer them I am a pretty open person.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] May I ask why there's a hashtag before your name? I'm just curious. 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] Chester was taken and someone told me to put a Hashtag in front of my name so I just did it and never changed my name since since I really wanted to use my name instead of some alias.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#FFD700]Carson Clark:[/color][/b][/url] I got ya. Thanks for spending your night with us #Chester. If there's anything you'd like to say before we go, now's the time!
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=uid=1234186][color=white][b]#Chester:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for the interview. That is all I have to say again thanks for the interview.[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930]Republic[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to this week's edition of the HF News. The 169th edition, I believe. Any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] I'd like to give a shoutout to Clique and Soulmate.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] Two of my favorite members, as well. So tell us what brought you to HackForums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] I came to HackForums very interested in the Gamertag section, but when I actually started posting and browsing the forum I noticed how good/big the community was so I decided to make this my home.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] I used to be a Gamertag connoisseur, myself. Do you still only buy and sell Gamertags here or have you expanded to other parts of the forum as well?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] I no longer sell/buy Gamertags, sadly that section seems to be dying. I've now moved on the SRPP forum and the Lounge. There are some really great people there, and I'm learning a lot from them.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] I also noticed you have a decent amount of posts in the League of Legends section. Is it safe to say that you're a PC gamer mostly, or do you play console too?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] Yes, that is correct. I would say I'm a PC gamer on the most part but that will never take away my love from my console gaming. If I had to choose a favorite though it would defiantly be console.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] Xbox or Playstation? Both have some pretty sweet new consoles coming out. (PS4 already released I believe?) Are you going to buy a next generation console?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] I play both, the majority of my time goes towards my Xbox though. I'm pretty sure I will get one of the next gen consoles in due time, but at the moment I'm pretty stumped on which one I want to get as they both look fairly amazing.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] Moving along, you've been here on the forums almost a year. What has been your greatest accomplishment so far, and do you have any future plans you'd like to achieve? 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] I have a list of accomplishments actually. These include : Hitting 1k posts, 200 rep, and Ub3r. Not that hard of tasks but I'm still very proud. My main goal at the moment is to be accepted into Void during the next recruitment, that's all I really hope for at the moment.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] Void, ehh? Not a bad milestone, indeed. So I have to ask, why the username Republic? Is it a Star Wars thing?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] Yes, it's always been a group that I've looked up to. Haha and no, I've always been interested in the government and things along that manner, I also recently purchased headphones by the brand of Sol Republic so that was a big contribution to me choosing my username.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] Okay, good. Thought you were trying to blow up the Death Star again. Anyway, tell us a bit about yourself as a person off the forums.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] I just recently turned 16, really into skating. I'm not that good as I'm still learning, but my friends are teaching my at my own pace. I also live in a very small town and I'm a student in High School. I'm a really "hands on" person, I assume that I will go straight into the oilfields with my dad when I get out of high school. If not that, then I plan on going to college for computer science. I'm the person in the crowd wearing a beanie, cargo shorts, and vans while everyone else is wearing boots and cowboy hats. I just try my best to be my own person.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] You're quite the well spoken individual from what I've seen. Before we go, what are your thoughts on the HF news? Anything to improve on? 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] I check out the HF news as much as possible since some of my friends are Writers, but from what I've always noticed is that it is extremely HQ and it looks as if tons of time is put into it every week. You guys at the HF news have nothing to worry about, everything seems perfect in my opinion.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=787112][color=#FF69B4][b]Saturday:[/b][/color][/url] Awesome. Anything else before I go?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1605930][color=white][b]Republic:[/b][/color][/url] Saturday is my best friend in the whole wide world.
[/spoiler]
posts.subject: [11/18/13] - HF News

posts.message:
[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/iJLlX4wyRdaA7.png[/img][/align]
[color=white][b]Sony's PS4 Problems[/b][/color]
Sony has finally launched the PS4 in North America. However, the launch was very shaky. According to many PS4 owners and reviewers, the console has had many problems. Users have been experiencing console freezes, bricked consoles out of the box, firmware issues and game compatibility issues. A common problem was that the HDMI port in the console was faulty and had caused many other problems. Electronic Arts issued a statement saying that the PS4 firmware was affecting their games and had issued an alert on their website. Along with these problems, game reviews were extremely low - Sony had posted a statement saying they were disappointed with the low PS4 review scores. "Yeah, it's disappointing to see some of the low scores. I haven't spent enough time reading reviews, but I would characterize them as mixed," Yoshida told GamesIndustry International. The Playstation Network has had many connection problems due to a high amount of users and Sony would like gamers to be patient. Many gamers have decided to switch to Xbox One due to these hardware and firmware issues.

[color=white][b]Xbox One: Games with Gold Program Continues[/b][/color]
Earlier in 2013, Microsoft announced the Games with Gold program on the Xbox 360. However, Microsoft confirmed through Twitter that the Games with Gold program will eventually arrive on Xbox One. A launch date for the Xbox One program has not been announced, however Microsoft more details are coming in 2014. You can currently download "Iron Brigade" on Xbox 360 for free via the Games with Gold program. The Xbox One launches on November 22nd in 13 regions. 

[color=white][b]Xbox One: 1000 GS minimum on downloadable titles[/b][/color]
According to official achievement lists, downloadable titles will now feature at least 1000 GS. Microsoft confirmed this to be true, with the first public achievement list for Xbox One being Halo: Spartan Assault. Downloadable titles previously featured 200 GS, however Microsoft updated this to 400 in 2013. Posts in various forums show that achievement hunters are very happy with this change. 

[color=white][b]PS4 Review Scores: (Metacritic)[/b][/color]
Knack - 58
Killzone: Shadow Fall - 75
Resogun - 82

[color=white][b]Video of the Week[/b][/color]
PS4 Unboxing - So what happens when 16 IGN editors unbox the PS4 at the same time? Let's take a look shall we...

[align=center][yt]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PTVCbZVa9co[/yt][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/iX3LnqNnUtm2v.png[/img][/align]
[b][color=white]Minecraft PS3 Edition Before NextGen?[/color][/b]
After an announcement from 4J Studios (the lead developer in the Xbox 360 version of Minecraft), it's been made very clear that the PS3 is going to be getting a taste of Minecraft before that of the nextgen consoles. Though Sony's newest console-- the PS4-- has already been released, it seems 4J studios still has a priority to release the game for the PS3. The aforementioned, then, is made very clear in [url=https://twitter.com/4JStudios/statuses/399821608463769600]a Tweet[/url] made by the developer. That being said, the 360 version will shortly be receiving the TU14 update as well.

[b][color=white]A Special Treat from the Mindcrackers![/color][/b]
Celebrating Minecon 2013's good times and happenings, the Mindcrackers-- a special group of YouTubers who play on a vanilla-UHC whitelist-only server-- have decided to make and release a special adventure map for all of their viewers to play. It features mysteries, adventures, and journeys all in a comfortable and convenient Minecraft world. The map can be downloaded as well as previewed on Guud's website [url=http://www.guudelp.com/minecon2013/]here[/url]-- have fun!

[b][color=#43a828]Hacker[/color][color=#9428a8]Craft[/color] [color=white]News[/color][/b]
The HackerCraft news is still hereby postponed. As mentioned in the previous edition of the Minecraft news, updates will be kept in the HackerCraft section as they come up. Everyone's patience thus far has, is, and will be appreciated.

[b][color=#ffcc33]Featured Server of the Week:[/color] [color=white]Mineplex[/color][/b]
Featuring some of the most unique mini-games and housing some of the most renowned Minecrafters on YouTube, Mineplex is definitely an amazing server to have some fun on. Most mini-games on the server will allow a choice of a kit to play with allowing the variety to roam; you can then even purchase ULTRA-- their only donator rank-- to get even more of them. Feel free to connect and play today at mineplex.com!

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/ibx5gFlLxx9bJ1.png[/img][/align]
[color=white][b]Giant Child Pornography Ring Busted[/b][/color]
A Canadian led investigation titled Project Spade came to a close Thursday with the bust of a huge pedophile ring. The 2011 arrest of the owner of a large website that hosted over 45 terabytes of child pornography and had a revenue of over $4 million led to 341 arrests around the world. 386 children have been rescued.

[color=white][b]Youngest Person Diagnosed with Lung Cancer[/b][/color]
Last week we reported that Chinese pollution has caused major concerns over poor visibility that rendered many of the nation's security cameras useless, now the pollution has uncovered more deadly concerns. An 8-year old girl was diagnosed with lung cancer due to pollution, the youngest recorded pollution-related cased of lung cancer in the world.

[color=white][b]Secret International Patent Agreement Leaked[/b][/color]
WikiLeaks released a leaked draft of the Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement last week. The TPP is a trade agreement that would vastly expand on the power of the patent and expanding on what can be protected. The leak precedes the November 19-24 summit in Salt Lake City, Utah where many final decisions will me made regarding the treaty. Some proposed changes would increase patent coverage to include things such as biological processes, animals, video game rules, software, and artwork.

[color=white][b]Tornadoes Ravage Illinois[/b][/color]
Several Midwest cities were destroyed Sunday by over 80 tornadoes with winds reaching up to 200 miles per hour. As of this writing the death toll is 5 with many more injured. Several cities have declared a state of emergency and are requiring people to stay out of the streets so emergency vehicles can reach the people who need help.

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/ibnGw6pRzIThtL.png[/img][/align]
[color=white][b]Apple pushes iOS 7.0.4 Update With Redesigned iBooks and iTunes U Apps[/b][/color]
When iOS 7 launched originally, only a few of the default apps on iDevices were redesigned. With the latest iOS update, Apple gave a whole new look to their two apps iBooks and iTunes  U. The new style of these apps are much like the Newsstand app. The update also fixes minor bug issues within the FaceTime app. 

[color=white][b]Mozilla Doesn't Plan To Sell Firefox Phones In US[/b][/color]
Most US citizens will have to wait for a long while before getting their hands on a Firefox-powered phone. Mozilla executive Mitchell Baker stated that they were looking to market to developing nations, since Apple and Google don't really sell there. They have not determined a release date for most locations yet.

[color=white][b]Sears To Turn Old Auto Centers Into Data Centers[/b][/color]
The large department store is supposedly turning their old Auto Centers into server farms. Ubiquity Critical Environments, which is the IT infrastructure arm owned by Sears, wants to put these servers in and offer them to the public. They plan to offer the services to enterprise customers who are working on large IT projects. There is no word on when these will be available.

[color=white][b]Wolfram Working On A Prgramming Language[/b][/color]
Wolfram Research, best known for their computational app WolframAlpha, is working on a new project which they say is their most important yet. The language itself is said to be a general purpose programming language, but it will be largely self contained. This means most of the time you will not have to point to external libraries to accomplish your tasks. It is also going to be aimed at experts and novices alike, meaning that you will be able to get to programming in no time. The company has kept most details about this new language vague, but the public is hoping to hear something more about it soon.

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/i8dSB5532O5GV.png[/img][/align]
[color=white][b]Justin Bieber's New Social Network[/b][/color]
Justin Bieber, as well as other A-listers including Floyd Mayweather, venture capitalist Shervin Pishevar, and angel investor Tom McInerney, led a $1.1 million dollar investment round into a new social network. There are currently no details about what it will be about except that it's expected to show up in the Apple Store later this week. "We got to know Justin after he began playing our games and tweeting about it," said RockLive CEO John Shahidi. The social network site is called "Shots of Me", a miniaturized social network for exchanging selfies with people in your friends list. Sorta like SnapChat. According to Complex, "The app is centered around an ethic of anti-trolling positivity. In place of public comments, Shots of Me uses a direct messaging system that requires both parties to follow one another before a message can be sent. “The commenting thing was something [Bieber] really cared about,” CEO John Shahidi said in an interview with TechCrunch. “Not just for himself, but for the kids. He said ‘I want a platform where my fans don’t have to deal with [harassment and negativity].’” The app will hopefully become a catalyst for a less antagonistic and more mutually encouraging world, and when hostility must appear it will be tightly controlled.

[color=white][b]A$AP Rocky Takes MTV To Hometown Harlem Block Where His Brother Was Shot[/b][/color]
During Wednesday's episode of "RapFix Live," Rocky took MTV on a tour of a few landmarks from his childhood. "Sometimes we used to cut during lunch and go window shopping or try to boost something from Barneys," Rocky said laughing, as he recalled his early passion for fashion. "I used to travel from the Bronx all the way down here and I'm be honest, we used to come to school to get girls and show off our outfits — that's all we used to come to school for back in the day. I didn't have to be in school all week, but once they gave a pop quiz I'd ace it." The moment got emotional when the A$AP Rocky recounted that his brother lost his life just a few feet away from where they were standing. "Ricky, my older brother, he died on this block," Rocky said, bringing back the painful memory. "He got shot right around the corner at 20 years old. I was going to school down the block at the time and I remember my mom rushed [over to tell me] 'your brother just got shot.' He was so tough I thought he was gonna make it," Rocky added. "I didn't think he was gonna pass and but we were up the block at St. Luke's [Hospital] and that's when it happened. February 22, that's when they announced it." The struggle is real.

[color=white][b]Jay Z Issues Statement on Barneys Racial Profiling Controversy[/b][/color]
Jay Z (hyphen dropped now) has agreed to move forward with Barneys. Jay Z - who's releasing a holiday collection with the store on November 20 - had previously stated "I'm looking into it." Later revelations found that the store had indeed changed their security policies, and as a result, disproportionately targeted black shoppers. Jay has now weighed in on the matter, in a post to "Life + Times". Stating that he's keeping the collection with Barneys, and it will launch as planned. Jay brokered "one hell of a deal" according to Complex magazine:
- According to the press release, Jay's going to have a leadership role and a seat on a council "specifically convened to deal with the issue of racial profiling." 
- As opposed to the 25% of the proceeds Jay's charity was going to get from the collection, Jay negotiated a deal with Barneys where, now, 100% of the proceeds from the collection will now go to Jay's charity, The Shawn Carter Foundation.
- The Shawn Carter Foundation will also receive 10% of all sales from Barneys New York and Barneys.com on November 20, when his collection drops.  

[color=white][b]Music Video of the Week[/b][/color]
[spoiler]
[yt]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qfR00nu5xQw[/yt]
[/spoiler]

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/ih4DkNmH5M949.png[/img][/align]
This is basically my own little corner to type up my thoughts and some standpoints on different topics.
---
Growth. There are times in your life, stages if you will, of deep yearning for freedom and progress. Many of these stages occur during the youth, and can inhibit your ability to enjoy what you have. I, myself, am currently coming to terms with the idea that I just proposed. I wish to move on and make something of myself, yet I am constantly held back by social pretenses and a general lack of individualism. I can only do what I would advise you: do your best to make the most of what you have, and when the time comes--which it will--you'll be ready.

[align=center][img]http://i.minus.com/ibvB54RmtuIUlF.png[/img][/align]

"Which next-gen console will you be buying?"

[i]"PS4 - The more powerful and best console for GAMERS. Xbox One 
has surprised me by focusing on things that have nothing to do with 
gaming - for example, they're trying to make the Xbox look good by 
making you able to watch TV on it. Surely, if I wanted to watch TV, I 
would switch to a regular TV. Anyway, ranting aside, it came to my 
great amusement that Microsoft congratulated Sony on their release 
(check out their Facebook and Twitter pages). I wasn't too sure whether 
it was sarcastic or a genuine congratulations. Regardless, I am still 
buying the PS4."[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=823754][i]-McDork[/i][/url]

[align=right][i]"I will be buying the Xbox One. Me being a huge gamer, 
I have seen numerous threads and discussions on various forums talking 
about which console is better. For me, its not about which is better. Its 
about the one I feel will benefit me the most. I like the controller of Xbox 
One, I like microsoft support, and all my friends are getting the Xbox One. 
This gives me reason to get it as well."[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=874827][i]-Skwillex[/i][/url][/align]

[i]"The PS4, definitely. My friend went to midnight launch and invited 
me and 6 more friends over. And maaaan, that was amazing. We all 
played Ghosts and quicked-scoped for about an hour. Nothing on 
the controller feels out of place or foreign. I advise everybody to get 
it. I'm getting it and I will kill, murder, lynch, and stab anybody who 
dares to get in my way of owning the PS4"[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=865003][i]-kayy6688[/i][/url]

[align=right][i]"I think that the PS4 would be the better choice as it 
runs in 1040p while the Xbox one runs 720p. I'm not too happy 
about learning a whole new button layout but I still want to be able 
to play with my friends buying the new consoles. I might not buy 
one at all, I've really always been a PC gamer, with some xbox on 
the side."[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1329472][i]-๖MonsterCat๖[/i][/url][/align]

The topic for next week is "How do you feel about the BitCoin? Especially with recent price fluctuations."

To send in your entries for the next edition, PM [url=http://goo.gl/FzyrO]Sir[/url].
